questions.question: Greek civilization began in an area dominated by _____.
Greek civilization began in a river valley.
Communities in ancient Greece were _____.

choices.answer: separated by rugged mountains and valleys

questions.question: Greek myths describe an early civilization that developed _____.
The Minoans were an island civilization and Myceneans a mainland civilization.
Trade was important for all the groups of people who lived on or around Greece.
On the mainland, the Greek civilization _____.

choices.answer: developed after the Dark Age, around 700 BC
suffered a further decline after the Dark Age

questions.question: The geography of Greece did not influence the formation of independent city-states.
The Greeks developed the modern concept of citizenship.
Which of the following statements is true about city-states?

choices.answer: Most free men and women who owned land were citizens.
Women and children could not be citizens, though they had some rights.
In most city-states, only land-owning males could be citizens.

questions.question: As Greek city-states grew, political changes occurred, such as _____.

choices.answer: tyrants rose to rule many city-states
nobles seized power from the merchants
farmers seized power from the merchants

questions.question: In Greek city-states, one of three forms of government typically developed: a tyranny, an oligarchy, or a democracy.
An oligarchy is _____.

choices.answer: rule by a single leader with total authority
rule by all citizens sharing power together
rule by a small group of wealthy people

questions.question: Sparta developed a military culture, and beginning at age 7, boys trained in military skills.
Sparta was ruled by _____.

choices.answer: an oligarchy with a council of elders that consisted of land-owning males
a tyrant with a council of merchants
a democracy with an assembly of land-owning males
a military commander with a council of merchants

questions.question: Sparta developed coins to make trading easier.
Athens educated its males differently from Sparta in that ____.

choices.answer: males studied only music and art
young male students studied arithmetic, geometry, and public speaking
male and female students studied arithmetic, geometry, and public speaking

questions.question: Athens benefitted from the rule of three fair tyrants in the 500s BC.
Solon gave citizenship to Athenians who did not own land.
Which of the following statements is true?

choices.answer: Athens never encouraged its young people to develop military skills.
In Athens, women participated in the governing assembly.
Under Cleisthenes, every male citizen had a chance to be a council member.
Sparta encouraged trade by welcoming foreign visitors.

questions.question: In the 500s BS, Persia _____.

choices.answer: organized an army made up of slaves
built an empire about the size of the continental US
seized power from the Greeks and ruled the Mediterranean area

questions.question: Around 600 BC, a Persian religious teacher named Zoroaster began preaching that Ahura Mazda was the creator of all.
The Persian Empire was divided into _____.
The Persian Empire had a full-time professional army; Athens had a volunteer army.
In the 400s BC, the Persians tried to expand _____.

choices.answer: in Europe and began by invading Greece
in the east and invaded what is now Afghanistan
in Africa and invaded North Africa

questions.question: The Persians defeated the Greeks at Marathon.
At the battle between Greeks and Persians at Thermopylae, _____.

choices.answer: the Spartans and Athenians defeated the Persians
the Persians won, although the Athenians fought until the end
Spartans fought until the end, but the Persians won
the Persians won the battle easily

questions.question: In the battle of Salamis _____.

choices.answer: the Greeks had a larger navy and defeated the Persians
the Persians defeated the Greeks with their faster ships
the Persians gathered a large naval force and won the battle
the Greeks defeated the Persian navy because they had smaller, faster ships

questions.question: After the Greeks defeated the Persians at Plataea, the Persians stopped trying to conquer Greece.
Which of the following statements is true?

choices.answer: Greek city-states united to prevent Persia from conquering Greece.
Persian provinces sent volunteer soldiers to fight against Greece.
In the Persian Empire, governors of satrapies were called ephors.

questions.question: In the 400s BC, the rule of Pericles in Athens was called _____.
The government of Athens evolved into a system of representative democracy like that of the United States.
The Athenian citizens with political rights included _____.
Athens had many enslaved people who were captured during battle and became prisoners of Athens.
The Delian League lost power and influence because _____.

choices.answer: Pericles tried to take control of the league and its member states
Sparta joined the league and member states resigned in protest
the Persians paid Greek city-states to resign from the league
Sparta took control of the league

questions.question: Historians call the war between Sparta and Athens the Peloponnesian War because Athens was located on Peloponnesus.
Early in the Peloponnesian War, Sparta _____.

choices.answer: marched into Athens and burned it
surrounded Athens, cutting off entry to the city-state
deliberately spread the plague in Athens

questions.question: In order to fight the Athenian navy, Sparta _____.

choices.answer: asked other city-states for money to build a navy
borrowed ships from other members of the Delian league

questions.question: Sparta defeated Athens in the Peloponnesian War.
Which of the following statements is true about the Peloponnesian War?

choices.answer: Spartan and Persian soldiers fought side-by-side against Athens.
A plague in Athens killed many people including Pericles.
Persia sent its navy in support of Sparta.
When the Spartan navy was defeated, they could no longer get supplies.
